item.title: How the humble fruit fly transformed research on genes, tissue, disease & evolution - ThePrint
item.description:
How the Humble Fruit Fly Transformed Research in Genetics and Beyond

Publication Date: 2023-10-04 | Source: The Conversation

The common fruit fly, or Drosophila melanogaster, has been a pivotal species in scientific research for over a century, leading to significant discoveries in genetics, disease control, and evolution.

  • The fruit fly originates from the woodlands of south-central Africa and has a unique association with human communities.
  • It is extensively used in genetics research, having contributed to foundational discoveries about genes and chromosomes.
  • The species plays a vital role in understanding tissue damage and regeneration, particularly in cancer research.
  • It has contributed to disease control efforts, specifically in combating diseases like dengue through the use of Wolbachia bacteria.
  • Fruit flies are also used to study evolutionary processes, especially in the conservation of threatened species.
“Drosophila melanogaster has contributed to our well-being. Perhaps admire it rather than reaching for that can of fly spray.”

The humble fruit fly is much more than a nuisance; it has profoundly impacted various fields of research and continues to be an invaluable tool for scientists.

item.title: 'A lot of flu out there': Winter wave of respiratory illnesses spark concern across the US; here's what t - The Times of India
item.description:
'A Lot of Flu Out There': Winter Wave of Respiratory Illnesses Spark Concern Across the US

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Flu season has intensified in the US, leading to a surge in respiratory infections including flu, Covid-19, and RSV. Recent data indicates widespread illness across 40 states, raising alarms from health authorities.

  • Flu, Covid-19, and RSV infections are overlapping and causing significant symptoms across the population.
  • The CDC reports increased hospitalization rates due to these respiratory illnesses.
  • Vaccination coverage for flu, Covid-19, and RSV remains inadequate.
  • Children and older adults are particularly affected, with rising hospitalization rates.
“A lot of flu out there,” - Carrie Reed, CDC

This winter wave of respiratory illnesses highlights ongoing public health challenges as vaccine coverage remains low and respiratory viruses continue to spread.

item.title: Akshay Kumar CONFIRMED In Stree 3, Dinesh Vijan Calls Him 'Thanos' Of Maddock Horror-Comedy Universe | Excl - News18
item.description:
Akshay Kumar to Star in Stree 3 as 'Thanos' of Maddock Horror-Comedy Universe

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

Akshay Kumar's return to the Maddock Films' horror-comedy universe has been confirmed for Stree 3, with Dinesh Vijan humorously referring to him as the 'Thanos' of the franchise.

  • Akshay's cameo in Stree 2 was highly successful, helping it become the highest-grossing Bollywood film of all time.
  • The upcoming Stree 3 is set for release on August 13, 2025.
  • Akshay hinted at his role by stating, “Dinesh and Jyoti will have to decide that they’re the ones to pump in the money.”
  • Dinesh Vijan confirmed Akshay’s involvement, saying, “Of course, he’s a part of the universe! He’s our Thanos.”
  • Stree 2 starred Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor, earning over Rs 600 crore in India.
“Of course, he’s a part of the universe! He’s our Thanos (laughs).” - Dinesh Vijan

The anticipation for Stree 3 is high, as fans are eager to see how Akshay Kumar's character will evolve within the beloved horror-comedy universe.

item.title: US Surgeon General calls for cancer warnings on alcohol - Deccan Herald
item.description:
US Surgeon General Calls for Cancer Warnings on Alcohol

Published: 05 January 2025
Source: Bloomberg News

Alcoholic beverages should carry cancer warnings, according to US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy, highlighting the alarming lack of public awareness regarding the health risks associated with alcohol consumption.

  • Less than 50% of Americans are aware that alcohol increases cancer risks.
  • Alcohol is responsible for approximately 100,000 cancer cases and 20,000 related deaths annually in the US.
  • The introduction of cancer warnings on alcoholic drinks could redirect attention to serious health risks known for decades.
  • The American Medical Association supports the call for updated warning labels.
  • A global issue, with 741,300 cancer cases attributed to alcohol consumption worldwide in 2020.
“alcohol consumption at any level, not just heavy alcohol use or addictive alcohol use, is a modifiable risk factor for cancer” - AMA President Bruce Scott

The Surgeon General's advisory aims to enhance awareness of alcohol-related health risks and foster better public health policies regarding alcohol consumption.

item.title: "Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not": Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Retirement In Your Hands, Playing For India Is Not: Rohit Sharma Served Big Warning

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent interview, Rohit Sharma discussed his cricketing future amid speculations of his retirement, clarifying that while retirement is a personal decision, his place in the team will ultimately be determined by the selectors.

  • Sanjay Manjrekar emphasizes that while players can decide on retirement, performance determines team selection.
  • Rohit has opted out of the latest Test match due to poor form and expresses that he won't retire soon.
  • Manjrekar notes the impact of selectors' choices on players' careers, highlighting a respect for hierarchy in the selection process.
“Retirement is in your hands, but playing for India is not,” Sanjay Manjrekar stated.

The conversation sheds light on the balancing act of personal ambitions versus team requirements in professional sports.

item.title: Leopard, three tigers die of Avian flu in Maharashtra’s Gorewada Rescue Centre - The Hindu
item.description:
Leopard, three tigers die of Avian flu in Maharashtra’s Gorewada Rescue Centre

Published Date: January 05, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Four animals, including three tigers and a leopard, have died due to H5N1 Avian Influenza at the Gorewada Rescue Centre in Nagpur, Maharashtra. A red alert has been issued by the Government of India to prepare zoos across the state for potential outbreaks.

This tragic event has triggered enhanced bio-security measures to prevent further infections among animals and protect staff.

  • Three tigers and one leopard died from H5N1 Avian Influenza.
  • Red alert issued by the Government of India for preparedness in all zoos.
  • Veterinarians released a detailed protocol to prevent bird access to animal enclosures.
  • Symptoms observed in animals included limping, diarrhoea, and fever.
  • Advisories aim to minimize AI transmission risk and ensure rapid containment.
“H5N1 is a lethal virus but other variants may not be this lethal, and animals can be saved on timely treatment,” - Shatanik Bhagwat, Divisional Manager, Gorewada Project.

The ongoing situation stresses the need for vigilance and safety protocols in wildlife facilities to combat the spread of Avian Influenza.

item.title: PM Modi in Delhi live updates: PM Modi hits out at Arvind Kejriwal's AAP, calls it ‘Aapda’ at Rohini rally - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi Criticizes AAP Government in Delhi

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses crowd in Delhi, criticizing the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for lacking a vision for the city’s development and inaugurating several key infrastructure projects ahead of elections.

  • PM Modi inaugurated the Namo Bharat rapid transit train corridor, worth ₹12,000 crores.
  • Promised continuation of welfare schemes by the Delhi government if BJP is elected.
  • Criticized AAP, calling it a ‘punishment’ for residents.
  • New Delhi to have rapid transit connectivity and an extension of the Magenta Line.
  • Delhi Metro projects worth over ₹6,230 crores were laid as foundation stones.
“Any responsibility to be given to 'Aapda' means punishment for people of Delhi.” - PM Modi

The Prime Minister’s visit marked a significant push for infrastructure improvement in Delhi, with promises for future developments and addressing political rivalry.

item.title: Box Office: Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India Overtaking Baahubali 2 - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India Overtaking Baahubali 2

Publication Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has officially dethroned Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India, achieving a total gross of Rs. 1,352 crore.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed Rs. 1345 crore at the Indian box office after five Saturdays.
  • It is part of a group of over twenty films that have reached the highest-grossing title in India's box office history.
  • The film's success was significantly bolstered in the Hindi-speaking belt of India.
  • The previous record-holder, Baahubali 2, held the title for over seven years.
“It took 7 years, 8 months and 3 days for a film to finally dethrone Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India and that film is Pushpa 2.”

Pushpa 2's rise to the top is a remarkable feat in Indian cinema, affirming its cultural and financial impact within the film industry.

item.title: Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 Becomes Highest Grossing Film in India Overtaking Baahubali 2 - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Becomes India's Highest Grossing Film, Surpassing Baahubali 2

Updated on: January 05, 2025 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has dethroned Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India after nearly 8 years. The film grossed Rs. 1,352 crore at the box office, surpassing the previous record.

  • Pushpa 2 grossed Rs. 6 crore on its fifth Saturday, bringing its total to Rs. 1,345 crore.
  • Allu Arjun's performance and the film's appeal in the Hindi belt contributed significantly to its success.
  • It is one of over twenty films that have held the title of highest-grosser in Indian cinema history.
  • The history of box office records includes early films like Kismet (1943) and Mother India (1957).
“It took 7 years, 8 months and 3 days for a film to finally dethrone Baahubali 2 as the highest-grossing film in India.”

Pushpa 2's achievement highlights the evolving landscape of Indian cinema and the growing dominance of regional films in the mainstream box office.

item.title: "Gautam Gambhir Should Be Saying...": Sunil Gavaskar Drops 'Domestic Cricket' Bombshell - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Should Be Saying...: Sunil Gavaskar Drops 'Domestic Cricket' Bombshell

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: NDTV

Legendary Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar emphasized the importance of domestic cricket for Indian players, particularly in light of poor performances in recent international series against New Zealand and Australia. He urged batters to participate in the upcoming Ranji Trophy, highlighting the need for commitment and technical improvement.

  • Gavaskar expressed concern over Indian batters' performance in recent series.
  • He urged players to play in the Ranji Trophy without excuses.
  • Gavaskar noted that domestic cricket is crucial for the upcoming WTC cycle.
  • He emphasized the need for commitment from players like Gautam Gambhir.
  • Young cricketers like Yashasvi Jaiswal are seen as essential for the future of Indian cricket.
"You do not have that commitment. We need commitment. You are not playing... for Indian cricket, you cannot return to the Test squad." - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, Gavaskar's remarks highlight the critical role of domestic cricket in developing future talent and improving the national team's performance.

item.title: ‘Disgusting mentality’: Congress reacts to Ramesh Bidhuri's 'cheeks' remark for Priyanka Gandhi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Condemns Ramesh Bidhuri's Controversial Remark about Priyanka Gandhi

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses Congress leader Supriya Srinate's reaction to Ramesh Bidhuri's controversial comment about Priyanka Gandhi, criticizing it as a reflection of an anti-women mentality within the BJP.

  • Ramesh Bidhuri made a sexist remark comparing the smoothness of roads to Priyanka Gandhi's cheeks.
  • Supriya Srinate condemned the statement, calling it reflective of a disgusting mentality towards women.
  • Bidhuri defended himself by comparing his comment to a past remark by Lalu Prasad Yadav regarding Hema Malini.
  • The BJP has officially nominated Bidhuri as a candidate for the Kalkaji assembly constituency.
“BJP is extremely anti-women. Ramesh Bidhuri's statement regarding Priyanka Gandhi is not only shameful but also shows his disgusting mentality towards women.” - Supriya Srinate

The controversy adds to the ongoing discussions about the treatment of women in politics, especially regarding comments made by male politicians.

item.title: several killed as Advanced Light Helicopter of the indian coast guard crashes in Gujarat's Porbandar - The Hindu
item.description:
Several Killed as Advanced Light Helicopter of the Indian Coast Guard Crashes in Gujarat's Porbandar

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: The Hindu

An Advanced Light Helicopter of the Indian Coast Guard crashed during landing at Porbandar airport, Gujarat, resulting in the tragic death of three crew members, including two pilots.

  • The accident occurred on January 5, 2025, at 12:10 PM.
  • Three crew members — two pilots and one air crew diver — were onboard and sustained severe injuries.
  • They were rushed to a local hospital but unfortunately did not survive their injuries.
  • The incident highlights concerns over safety protocols for aircraft landings.
“The three crew members died at the hospital,” said Inspector Rajesh Kanmiya.

This incident is a sad reminder of the risks faced by those in the aviation and defense sectors, and it underscores the need for ongoing safety measures to protect personnel in high-risk occupations.

item.title: Deva teaser: Shahid Kapoor channels Amitabh Bachchan, surpassing raw energy of Kabir Singh - The Indian Express
item.description:
Deva Teaser: Shahid Kapoor Channels Amitabh Bachchan, Surpassing Raw Energy of Kabir Singh

Date: January 5, 2024
Source: The Indian Express

The teaser for the highly anticipated action thriller Deva showcases Shahid Kapoor's return to the big screen in a powerful role. The 52-second teaser features no dialogue but emphasizes Shahid's signature swagger, incredible dance moves, and intense action sequences.

  • Shahid Kapoor plays a fearless cop dedicated to solving cases.
  • The teaser features impressive dance sequences and high-octane action.
  • Shahid's portrayal hints at a fierceness surpassing his role in Kabir Singh.
  • The film also pays homage to Amitabh Bachchan's legacy.
  • Directed by Rosshan Andrrews, Deva will release on January 31, 2024.
“The teaser promises a film packed with high-octane action, mesmerizing dance moves, and a gripping storyline.”

With a strong production team and a compelling cast, Deva is expected to exceed fans' expectations and make a significant impact upon its release.

item.title: Delhi to Meerut South in 40 minutes: All about the Namo Bharat RRTS corridor inaugurated by PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi to Meerut in 40 Minutes: Namo Bharat RRTS Corridor Inaugurated by PM Modi

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On January 5, 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13-km section of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) corridor, significantly reducing travel time between Delhi and Meerut.

  • The RRTS corridor connects Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh to New Ashok Nagar in Delhi.
  • The full 55-km RRTS corridor includes 11 operational stations.
  • Passenger services are set to commence at 5 PM with trains running every 15 minutes.
  • Fares are ₹150 for standard coach and ₹225 for premium coach.
  • The newly inaugurated section has a 6 km underground stretch, including key interchanges with the Delhi Metro.
  • The project aims to improve regional transit and includes 16 Namo Bharat stations.
“Delhi is now seamlessly connected to Meerut, cutting travel time by a third.”

This inauguration marks a significant expansion of the RRTS network, providing efficient and speedy transport options in the region.

item.title: Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

An Indian Coast Guard Advanced Light Helicopter (ALH) Dhruv crashed during a training sortie in Gujarat's Porbandar, resulting in the death of all three crew members aboard.

  • The helicopter faced technical difficulties before the crash.
  • The incident occurred during a routine training flight at the Coast Guard Air Enclave.
  • All three crew members, including two pilots, were killed.
  • The Coast Guard is currently investigating the incident.
  • This crash follows a recent safety upgrade on the ALH fleet due to prior accidents.
  • The Dhruv fleet has faced safety concerns and had been grounded previously.
"Three crew members were killed in the incident," a police official was quoted as saying.

The Coast Guard's investigation will determine the next steps following this tragic event, which reflects ongoing safety challenges with the helicopter fleet.

item.title: FPIs withdraw ₹4,285 crore in 3 trading sessions amid high valuations, global headwinds | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
FPIs Withdraw ₹4,285 Crore in 3 Trading Sessions Amid High Valuations, Global Headwinds

Publication Date: January 3, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

In the first three trading days of January, foreign investors withdrew ₹4,285 crore from Indian equities amidst concerns over upcoming earnings and high stock valuations. This marks a significant trend away from Indian investments following a net inflow of ₹15,446 crore in December.

  • Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) pulled out ₹4,285 crore during January 1-3.
  • Investor sentiment is cautious due to a strong dollar and high US bond yields.
  • FPIs are reassessing investments ahead of the Q3FY25 earnings season.
  • The depreciating rupee is impacting the attractiveness of Indian equities.
  • Net inflows for 2024 stand at only ₹427 crore, a stark contrast to the ₹1.71 lakh crore in 2023.
"FPIs selling is due to high valuations in the secondary market... in the primary market where the valuations are fair, FPIs have been sustained investors." - V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services

The outflows highlight a cautious stance from foreign investors, reflecting broader economic concerns and valuation challenges in the Indian market.

item.title: Sky Force Trailer: Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya Bring Tail Of India's 'Deadliest' Airstrike - News18
item.description:
Sky Force Trailer: Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya Showcase India's 'Deadliest' Airstrike

Publication Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

The trailer for the highly anticipated movie, Sky Force, featuring Akshay Kumar, has been released, revealing a story set against the backdrop of the 1965 India-Pakistan Air War.

  • The trailer introduces the intense characters of Indian Air Force officers portrayed by Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya.
  • Akshay features prominently, delivering a warning to Pakistan and announcing India's first airstrike.
  • Veer Pahariya's character goes missing during the strike, creating suspense about his fate.
  • The film also stars Sara Ali Khan, who plays Veer's love interest.
  • Directed by Sandeep Kewlani and Abhishek Kapur, the film will be released on January 24, 2025.
“This Republic Day, witness the untold story of a heroic sacrifice – the tale of India’s first and deadliest airstrike.” - Akshay Kumar

Sky Force is generating significant excitement among fans, with some hailing it as a potential blockbuster.

item.title: Prashant Kishor joins BPSC aspirants' protest, urges Tejashwi to lead the agitation - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Joins BPSC Protest, Urges Tejashwi Yadav to Lead

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prashant Kishor joined students protesting against the Bihar Civil Services (BPSC) exam early Sunday, urging RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav to lead the demonstrations.

  • Kishor expressed solidarity with students demanding the cancellation of the BPSC examination.
  • He encouraged Tejashwi Yadav to take charge of the protests.
  • Kishor stated, “This is not a dharna. This is the passion of the people of Bihar to better their conditions.”
  • Students are calling for the cancellation of the Integrated Combined (Preliminary) Competitive Examination (CCE) 2024 due to alleged question paper leaks.
“He (Tejashwi Yadav) is a tall leader... We care about the agenda of the students,” said Kishor.

Kishor’s involvement highlights the rising tensions surrounding the BPSC exam and the political implications as various leaders weigh in.
